channel.title: Enterprise cloud data plane. Any environment. Any service. on Data Plane
channel.description: Recent content in Enterprise cloud data plane. Any environment. Any service. on Data Plane

item.title: Everything generates data
item.description:
Yes, in this digital world, everything generates data, but before starting moving huge mount of data from your devices, we recommend to plan (data pipeline) your BigData project by following these steps:

Capture: Acquires, Integrates data.
Store: Classification, Consolidate, Transformation, Storage Design, etc.
Analysis: Exploration, visualization, modeling, prediction, etc.

Following we share some technical articles we wrote about these topics.

item.title: Automation in Big Data Projects
item.description:
If you are involved in Big Data, Data Lake, Machine Learning or IA projects, the big concern is how to move huge amount of data smoothly. The short answer is with automation. You will need to automatize bored, manual and heavy tasks along the Capture, Store and Analysis stages.

Below we share technical articles explaining step by step how to start with Apache NiFi, Ansible, WSO2 BAM, etc.

item.title: SOA, MOM and Microservices-based Architectures
item.description: Message Oriented Middleware (MOM) is a concept that involves the asynchronously passing of messages between applications. According to Wikipedia, Service-oriented architecture (SOA) is a style of software design where services are provided to the other components by application components, through a communication protocol over a network.

item.title: Contact
item.description: var submitted=false; Name* Email* Phone number* Message* Send

item.title: Security in Web Services
item.description:
This post describes how the world of Web Services and the world of information security are coming together. Web Services and security make a compelling match, because Web Services need security in order to widespread deployment, and security technologies need the ease of deployment provided by Web Services. In theory at least, this is a win-win situation. The downside, though, is that the technologies can be complex and difficult to understand.

This post will try to help you understand Web Service security by explaining these technologies.
